actions.name: Grapple
actions.hit: The creature is grappled (escape DC 11). At the start of the abomination's next turn, it uses Post-Mortem Explosion.

features.name: Aggressive
features.description: As a bonus action, the abomination can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

features.name: Post-Mortem Explosion
features.description: When the abomination dies, it explodes in a burst of necrotic energy. Each creature within <me-distance length='5' /> of it must succeed on a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 (8d6) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that is grappled by the abomination automatically fails its saving throw.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The adjutant makes two Arm Cannon attacks.

actions.name: Reaper Infection
actions.target: one organic creature that is grappled by the adjutant, incapacitated, or restrained
actions.hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0. An organic creature slain in this way becomes a Weakened Adjutant and becomes an Adjutant after a long rest.

features.name: Barrier
features.description: When the adjutant is dealt damage, if it has any barrier ticks remaining, remove one barrier tick and reduce the damage by 1d8.

features.name: Grappler
features.description: The adjutant has advantage on attack rolls against any creature grappled by it.

actions.name: Gore
actions.hit: 12 (3d4 + 5) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Maul
actions.miss: Hit or miss, if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw or be knocked prone and is grappled. A creature takes half damage on a successful saving throw.

features.name: Barrier
features.description: When the albino kath hound is dealt damage, if it has any barrier ticks remaining, remove one barrier tick and reduce the damage by 1d8.

features.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
features.description: The kath hound has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

features.name: Pack Tactics
features.description: The kath hound has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kath hound's allies is within <me-distance length='5' /> of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

features.name: Grappler
features.description: The kath hound has advantage on attack rolls against any creature grappled by it.

actions.name: Frag Grenade III
actions.description: The assault trooper targets an area within <me-distance length="25" />. Each creature within <me-distance length="10" /> of the target must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 3d12 piercing damage or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Rocket Launcher
actions.description: The atlas targets an area within <me-distance length='150' />. Each creature within <me-distance length='15' /> of the target must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 52 (8d12) thunder damage or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Smoke Grenade
actions.description: The atlas targets an area within <me-distance length="25" />. A cloud of thick smoke erupts out in a <me-distance length="10" adj/> cube centered on the target location. The cloud's area is heavily obscured and persists for 30 seconds. A moderate wind (<me-distance length="11" large num-only /> to <me-distance length="20" large /> per hour) can disperse the smoke after 1 round, and a strong wind (<me-distance length="21" large num-only override="or more {metric}"/> per hour) can do so immediately.

legendaryActions.name: Eject
legendaryActions.description: The pilot of the Atlas ejects, landing in an unoccupied space within <me-distance length='100' />. The pilot is an Assault Trooper. The Atlas then self-destructs. Each creature within a <me-distance length="15" adj /> radius must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 39 (6d12) thunder damage or half as much on a successful one.

legendaryActions.name: Mass Accelerator Cannon Attack
legendaryActions.description: The atlas makes a Mass Accelerator Cannon attack.

legendaryActions.name: Smash Attack
legendaryActions.description: The atlas makes a Smash attack.

actions.name: Wail
actions.description: The banshee lets out a wail. Each creature within <me-distance length='150' /> that can hear the wail must make DC 17 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save a creature is frightened for 1 minute.

features.name: Barrier
features.description: As an action or bonus action, the banshee gains 20 barrier ticks. When the banshee is dealt damage, if it has any barrier ticks remaining, remove one barrier tick and reduce the damage by 1d8.

legendaryActions.name: Cast a Power
legendaryActions.description: The banshee casts a power from its list of prepared powers, using a power slot as normal.

legendaryActions.name: Impale Attack
legendaryActions.description: The banshee uses its imaple attack.

legendaryActions.name: Wail Attack
legendaryActions.description: The banshee uses its wail.

reactions.name: Teleporting Dodge
reactions.description: In response to making a Dexterity saving throw, the banshee can use its reaction to teleport up to <me-distance length='10' /> away. If it is still within the affected area, it has advantage on the saving throw.

actions.name: ML-77 Missile Launcher
actions.description: Choose a creature within <me-distance length='150' /> that you can see and fire a missile at it. Each creature within a <me-distance length='10' adj /> cube of the target, including the target, must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save a creature takes 39 (6d12) thunder damage or half as much on a successful one.

features.name: Regeneration
features.description: The vorcha regains 4 hit points at the start of its turn. If the vorcha takes fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vorcha's next turn. The vorcha dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

actions.name: M-451 Firestorm
actions.description: Creatures within a <me-distance length='15' adj /> cone must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 14 (4d6) fire damage, or half as much damage on a successful one.

features.name: Aggressive
features.description: As a bonus action, the pyro can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

features.name: Regeneration
features.description: The pyro regains 4 hit points at the start of its turn. If the pyro takes fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the pyro's next turn. The pyro dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

reactions.name: Fortification
reactions.recharge: Recharges after a Short or Long Rest
reactions.description: As a reaction to being hit by an attack the pyro can see, it gains a +5 bonus to its AC until the start of its next turn (including against the triggering attack).

features.name: Aggressive
features.description: As a bonus action, the trooper can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

features.name: Regeneration
features.description: The trooper regains 4 hit points at the start of its turn. If the trooper takes fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the trooper's next turn. The trooper dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

reactions.name: Fortification
reactions.recharge: Recharges after a Short or Long Rest
reactions.description: As a reaction to being hit by an attack the trooper can see, it gains a +5 bonus to its AC until the start of its next turn (including against the triggering attack).

features.name: Aggressive
features.description: As a bonus action, the warlord can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

features.name: Tech Armor
features.description: As a bonus action, the warlord can activate its Tech Armor. It immediately gains 30 temporary hit points. While the legate has at least 1 of these temporary hit points remaining, it has +2 AC and resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

features.name: Rage
features.recharge: Recharges after a Short or Long Rest
features.description: If the warlord begins its turn with less than half of its hit points, it enters into a rage for 1 minute. While in a rage, all melee weapon attacks deal 5 additional bludgeoning damage.

features.name: Biotic Hammer
features.description: Before making an attack with its Krogan Warhammer, the warlord can charge the weapon with biotic force. On a hit, the attack deals an additional 9 (2d8) force damage and detonates the target if it was primed.

features.name: Electrical Hammer
features.description: Before making an attack with its Krogan Warhammer, the warlord can charge the weapon with electricity. On a hit, the attack deals an additional 7 (2d6) lightning damage and the target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or become stunned until the end of its next turn.

features.name: Aggressive
features.description: As a bonus action, the warrior can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

features.name: Shotgun Specialist
features.description: The warrior has advantage on shotgun weapon attacks against targets within the normal range of the shotgun.

features.name: Regeneration
features.description: The warrior regains 4 hit points at the start of its turn. If the warrior takes fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the warrior's next turn. The warrior dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

features.name: Incendiary Ammo
features.description: When the warrior hits with its M-27 Scimitar, the target takes an additional 1d4 fire damage and becomes primed: fire until the end of the warrior's next turn.

features.name: Tech Armor
features.description: As a bonus action, the centurion can activate its Tech Armor. It immediately gains 20 temporary hit points. While the centurion has at least 1 of these temporary hit points remaining, it has +2 AC.

features.name: Disruptor Ammo
features.description: When the centurion hits with its M-27 Scimitar, if the target is primed, the target detonates. Otherwise, the target becomes primed: lightning until the end of the centurion's next turn.

features.name: Shotgun Marksman
features.description: The centurion gains a +4 bonus to ranged weapon attacks with shotguns if the target is within normal range.

reactions.name: Tech Armor
reactions.description: As a reaction to taking damage, the centurion can activate its tech armor.

actions.name: ML-77 Missile Launcher
actions.description: Choose a creature within <me-distance length='150' /> that you can see and fire a missile at it. Each creature within a <me-distance length='10' adj /> cube of the target, including the target, must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save a creature takes 39 (6d12) thunder damage or half as much on a successful one.

features.name: Tech Armor
features.description: As a bonus action, the heavy can activate its Tech Armor. It immediately gains 10 temporary hit points. While the heavy has at least 1 of these temporary hit points remaining, it has +2 AC.

reactions.name: Tech Armor
reactions.description: As a reaction to taking damage, the heavy can activate its tech armor.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The legate makes 2 attacks with its M-76 Revenant or M-300 Claymore.

features.name: Tech Armor
features.description: As a bonus action, the legate can activate its Tech Armor. It immediately gains 30 temporary hit points. While the legate has at least 1 of these temporary hit points remaining, it has +2 AC and resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

features.name: Incendiary Ammo
features.description: When the centurion hits with its M-76 Revenant or M-300 Claymore, the target takes an additional 1d4 fire damage and becomes primed: fire until the end of the legate's next turn.

features.name: Leadership
features.recharge: Recharges after a Short or Long Rest
features.description: For 1 minute, the legate can utter a special command or warning whenever a non-hostile creature that it can see within <me-distance length='25' /> of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a d4 to its roll provided it can hear and understand the legate. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the legate is incapacitated.

reactions.name: Tech Armor
reactions.description: As a reaction to taking damage, the legate can activate its tech armor.

actions.name: Inferno Grenade III
actions.description:
The legionnaire targets an area within <me-distance length="25" />. Each creature within <me-distance length="10" /> of the target must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature suffers 3d4 fire damage or half as much on a successful one. The area within a <me-distance length="10" adj /> radius, centered on the target continues to burn for 1 minute.

A creature must also make the saving throw when it enters the burning space for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there.

features.name: Tech Armor
features.description: As a bonus action, the legionnaire can activate its Tech Armor. It immediately gains 10 temporary hit points. While the legionnaire has at least 1 of these temporary hit points remaining, it has +2 AC.

features.name: Disruptor Ammo
features.description: When the legionnaire hits with its M-15 Vindicator, if the target is primed, the target detonates. Otherwise, the target becomes primed: lightning until the end of the legionnaire's next turn.

reactions.name: Tech Armor
reactions.description: As a reaction to taking damage, the legionnaire can activate its tech armor.

actions.name: M-451 Firestorm
actions.description: Creatures within a <me-distance length='15' adj /> cone must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 14 (4d6) fire damage, or half as much damage on a successful one.

features.name: Aggressive
features.description: As a bonus action, the pyro can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The brute makes two Smash attacks or two Clobber attacks.

features.name: Blood Frenzy
features.description: The brute has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

features.name: Brutal Charge
features.description: If the brute moves at least <me-distance length='15' /> straight toward a target and then hits it with a smash attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The cannibal makes 2 Arm Cannon attacks.

actions.name: Frag Grenade III
actions.description: The cannibal targets an area within <me-distance length="25" />. Each creature within <me-distance length="10" /> of the target must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 3d12 piercing damage or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Cannibalize
actions.description: The cannibal spends its action consuming a creature with 0 hit points within <me-distance length='5' />. At the start of its next turn it gains 5 AC and 1d8 hit points and the consumed creature (including all of its weapons, armor, and items) is completely dissolved. If the creature is a player character, it dies. Cannibals prefer to use their cannibalize action over any other.

features.name: Pack Tactics
features.description: The cannibal has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the cannibal's allies is within <me-distance length='5' /> of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The centurion makes two M-96 Mattock attacks or two Stun Baton attacks.

actions.name: Frag Grenade III
actions.description: The centurion targets an area within <me-distance length="25" />. Each creature within <me-distance length="10" /> of the target must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 3d12 piercing damage or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Smoke Grenade
actions.description: The centurion targets an area within <me-distance length="25" />. A cloud of thick smoke erupts out in a <me-distance length="10" adj/> cube centered on the target location. The cloud's area is heavily obscured and persists for 30 seconds. A moderate wind (<me-distance length="11" large num-only /> to <me-distance length="20" large /> per hour) can disperse the smoke after 1 round, and a strong wind (<me-distance length="21" large num-only override="or more {metric}"/> per hour) can do so immediately.

features.name: Aggressive
features.description: As a bonus action, the centurion can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The collector assassin makes two Particle Rifle.

features.name: Barrier
features.description: When the collector assassin is dealt damage, if it has any barrier ticks remaining, remove one barrier tick and reduce the damage by 1d8.

features.name: Possessed Collector
features.description: When the collector assassin is possessed by a harbinger it gains temporary hit points equal to its total hit points and 6 barrier ticks. While it has barrier ticks it also gains resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The collector captain makes two Collector Assault Rifle attacks.

actions.name: Leadership
actions.recharge: Recharges after a Short or Long rest
actions.description: For 1 minute, the collector captain can utter a special command or warning whenever a non-hostile creature that it can see within <me-distance length='25' /> of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a d4 to its role provided it can hear and understand the collector captain. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the collector captain is incapacitated.

actions.name: Summon Seeker Swarm
actions.description: The collector captain summons 1d4 seeker swarms at an unoccupied space it can see within <me-distance length='25' />.

features.name: Barrier
features.description: When the collector captain is dealt damage, if it has any barrier ticks remaining, remove one barrier tick and reduce the damage by 1d8.

features.name: Pack Tactics
features.description: The collector captain has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the collector captain's allies is within <me-distance length='5' /> of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

features.name: Possessed Captain
features.description: When the captain is possessed by a harbinger it gains temporary hit points equal to its total hit points and 8 barrier ticks. While it has barrier ticks it also gains resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. Instead of summoning a seaker swarm, it summons a seeker plague.

features.name: Barrier
features.description: When the collector drone is dealt damage, if it has any barrier ticks remaining, remove one barrier tick and reduce the damage by 1d8.

features.name: Possessed Collector
features.description: When the collector drone is possessed by a harbinger it gains temporary hit points equal to its total hit points and 6 barrier ticks. While it has barrier ticks it also gains resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

actions.name: Bash
actions.hit: 13 (3d8) bludgeoning damage and the target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or become stunned until the end of its next turn.

legendaryActions.name: Assume Control
legendaryActions.description: The harbinger targets a friendly collector that is not incapacitated. The target creature becomes possessed and gains the benefits listed on its monster sheet. The harbinger can only assume control of one creature at a time. While it is assuming control, its speed becomes 0, attacking creatures have advantage, it automatically fails Strength and Dexterity saving throws, and it cannot cast any powers. If the harbinger is incapacitated, assume control ends. The harbinger can use its bonus action to end assume control. As a result, the targeted creature loses all benefits including any temporary hit points and barrier ticks.

legendaryActions.name: Barrier
legendaryActions.description: When the collector general is dealt damage, if it has any barrier ticks remaining, remove one barrier tick and reduce the damage by 1d8.

legendaryActions.name: Bash Attack
legendaryActions.description: The collector general makes one bash attack.

legendaryActions.name: Cast a Power
legendaryActions.description: The collector general casts a power from its list of prepared powers, using a power slot as normal.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The collector guardian makes two Collector Assault Rifle attacks.

actions.name: Hex Shield
actions.description: As a bonus action, the collector guardian generates a <me-distance length='5' /> tall and wide, hexagon-shaped shield with 5AC and 50 shield points which offers full-cover.

features.name: Barrier
features.description: When the collector guardian is dealt damage, if it has any barrier ticks remaining, remove one barrier tick and reduce the damage by 1d8.

features.name: Possessed Collector
features.description: When the collector guardian is possessed by a harbinger it gains temporary hit points equal to its total hit points and 6 barrier ticks. While it has barrier ticks it also gains resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

features.name: Warp Ammo
features.description: Successful ranged attacks on a target with an active barrier will strip away 2 barrier ticks and reduce the damage reduction by half. Warp ammo can detonate primed targets.

actions.name: Collector Web
actions.hit: The target is restrained by organic webbing. As an action, the restrained target can make a DC 14 Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp 5; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

actions.name: Frag Grenade III
actions.description: The collector trooper targets an area within <me-distance length="25" />. Each creature within <me-distance length="10" /> of the target must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 3d12 piercing damage or half as much damage on a successful one.

features.name: Barrier
features.description: When the collector trooper is dealt damage, if it has any barrier ticks remaining, remove one barrier tick and reduce the damage by 1d8.

features.name: Possessed Collector
features.description: When the collector trooper is possessed by a harbinger it gains temporary hit points equal to its total hit points and 6 barrier ticks. While it has barrier ticks it also gains resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The combat engineer makes two M-5 Phalanx attacks.

actions.name: Repair
actions.description: The combat engineer uses its action to repair a friendly, synthetic target within <me-distance length='5' /> for 1d8 hit points.

features.name: Deploy Turret
features.description: The combat engineer is equipped with 1 Turret (see Bestiary). As an action, the combat engineer can deploy the Turret on a level surface within <me-distance length='5' />. The Turret is controlled by the combat engineer and takes its turn at the end of the combat engineer's turn. The combat engineer can use an action to stow the Turret, placing it at another location with a subsequent action.

reactions.name: Guard
reactions.description: When a creature the defense drone can see attacks a target other than itself that is within <me-distance length='5' /> of it, it can use its reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll.

actions.name: Kamikaze Attack
actions.description: The disruption can use its action to immediately reduce its hit points to 0.

features.name: Post-mortem explosion
features.description: When the disruption drone drops to 0 hit points it explodes. Each creature within a <me-distance length='5' /> radius must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 13 (2d12) thunder damage, or half as much on a successful one.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The dragoon makes three Omni-whip attacks

features.name: Aggressive
features.description: As a bonus action, the dragoon can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

actions.name: Leadership
actions.recharge: Recharges after a Short or Long Rest
actions.description: For 1 minute, the commando can utter a special command or warning whenever a non-hostile creature that it can see within <me-distance length="30" /> of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a d4 to its roll provided it can hear and understand the commando. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the commando is incapacitated.

features.name: Aggressive
features.description: As a bonus action, the commando can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature it can see.

features.name: Barrier
features.description: As an action or bonus action, the commando gains 10 barrier ticks. When the commando is dealt damage, if it has any barrier ticks remaining, remove one barrier tick and reduce the damage by 1d8.

actions.name: Repair
actions.description: The engineer uses its action to repair a friendly, synthetic target within <me-distance length='5' /> for 1d8 hit points.

actions.name: Summon Combat Drone
actions.description: The engineer summons a Combat Drone.

features.name: Tech Armor
features.description: As a bonus action, the engineer can activate its Tech Armor. It immediately gains 10 temporary hit points. While the engineer has at least 1 of these temporary hit points remaining, it has +2 AC.

reactions.name: Tech Armor
reactions.description: As a reaction to taking damage, the engineer can activate its tech armor.

actions.name: ML-77 Missile Launcher
actions.description: Choose a creature within <me-distance length='150' /> that you can see and fire a missile at it. Each creature within a <me-distance length='10' adj /> cube of the target, including the target, must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save a creature takes 39 (6d12) thunder damage or half as much on a successful one.

actions.name: Repair
actions.description: The operative uses its action to repair a friendly, synthetic target within <me-distance length='5' /> for 1d8 hit points.

actions.name: Summon Combat Drone
actions.description: The operative summons a Combat Drone.

features.name: Tech Armor
features.description: As a bonus action, the operative can activate its Tech Armor. It immediately gains 10 temporary hit points. While the operative has at least 1 of these temporary hit points remaining, it has +2 AC.

reactions.name: Tech Armor
reactions.description: As a reaction to taking damage, the operative can activate its tech armor.

actions.name: Flashbang Grenade III
actions.description: The eclipse trooper targets an area within <me-distance length="25" />. Each creature within <me-distance length="10" /> of the target must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature is <me-condition id="blinded"/> until the end of it's next turn.

features.name: Pack Tactics
features.description: The creature has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the creature's allies is within <me-distance length='5' /> of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The vanguard makes 2 M-27 Scimitar attacks.

features.name: Barrier
features.description: As an action or bonus action, the vanguard gains 6 barrier ticks. When the vanguard is dealt damage, if it has any barrier ticks remaining, remove one barrier tick and reduce the damage by 1d8.

features.name: Tech Armor
features.description: As a bonus action, the vanguard can activate its Tech Armor. It immediately gains 10 temporary hit points. While the vanguard has at least 1 of these temporary hit points remaining, it has +2 AC.

reactions.name: Tech Armor
reactions.description: As a reaction to taking damage, the operative can activate its tech armor.

features.name: Slow Moving
features.description: The elcor has disadvantage on all Dexterity saving throws and skill checks.

actions.name: Pounce
actions.hit: 8 (2d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Stun
actions.hit: 9 (2d8) lightning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of its next turn.

features.name: Aggressive
features.description: As a bonus action, the fenris mech can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

features.name: Post-mortem Explosion
features.description: If damage reduces the FENRIS mech to 3 or fewer hit points, it deactivates its primary systems and remains stationary. Any additinonal damage done to the mech while in this state causes it to explode. Any creature within a <me-distance length='10' adj />-radius sphere must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or take 7 (3d4) lightning damage.

actions.name: Mass Accelerator Machinegun
actions.hit: 19 (3d12) piercing damage and 19 (3d12) radiant damage. The geth armature can make a burst fire attack instead.

actions.name: Siege Cannon
actions.description: The geth armature targets a creature within <me-distance length='150' /> and launches a homing projectile. The target must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 55 (10d10) radiant damage, or half as much on a successful one.

actions.name: Siege Pulse
actions.description: The geth armature releases a burst of electrostatic energy that disrupts armor biofeedback. Each creature within a <me-distance length='15' /> radius must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature wearing armor looses 1d4 to their Strength and Dexterity ability scores. This loss ends if the armor is repaired, removed, or replaced.

features.name: Repair Protocol
features.description: If the geth armature starts its turn with 0 shield points, it activates its repair protocol, collapsing into a compact shell. Until the start of its next turn, its speed becomes <me-distance length="0" override="0 {metric}"/> and it can take no Actions, but it is immune to all damage. At the start of its next turn, it regains 50 shields points.

actions.name: Multi-frag Grenade II
actions.description: The geth bomber targets 3 areas within <me-distance length="25" />. Each creature within <me-distance length="10" /> of each target must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 1d4 piercing damage or half as much on a successful one.

actions.name: Mass Accelerator Machinegun
actions.hit: 19 (3d12) piercing damage and 19 (3d12) radiant damage. The geth colossus can make a burst fire attack instead.

actions.name: Siege Cannon
actions.description: The geth colossus targets a creature within <me-distance length='150' /> and launches a homing projectile. The target must make a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 55 (10d10) radiant damage, or half as much on a successful one.

actions.name: Siege Pulse
actions.description: The geth colossus releases a burst of electrostatic energy that disrupts armor biofeedback. Each creature within a <me-distance length='15' /> radius must make a DC 20 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature wearing armor looses 1d4 to their Strength and Dexterity ability scores. This loss ends if the armor is repaired, removed, or replaced.

features.name: Repair Protocol
features.description: If the geth colossus starts its turn with 0 shield points, it activates its repair protocol, collapsing into a compact shell. Until the start of its next turn, its speed becomes <me-distance length="0" override="0 {metric}"/> and it can take no Actions, but it is immune to all damage. At the start of its next turn, it regains 50 shields points.

legendaryActions.name: Mass Accelerator Machinegun Attack
legendaryActions.description: The geth colossus makes a Mass Accelerator Machinegun attack.

legendaryActions.name: Siege Cannon Attack
legendaryActions.description: The geth colossus makes a Siege Cannon attack.

legendaryActions.name: Siege Pulse Attack
legendaryActions.description: The geth colossus uses its Siege Pulse

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The geth hunter makes two Geth Plasma Shotgun attacks.

features.name: Assassination
features.description: Once per turn, the geth hunter can deal an extra 7 (2d6) damage to one creature it hits with an attack if it has advantage on the attack roll. The attack must be made with a melee or ranged weapon.

features.name: Tactical Cloak
features.description: As a bonus action, the geth hunter activates its tactical cloak, becoming invisible for 1 minute. When the geth hunter makes a melee or ranged attack or uses a tech or combat power, tactical cloak ends.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The geth juggernaut makes two Bash attacks.

features.name: Aggressive
features.description: As a bonus action, the geth juggernaut can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The geth prime makes two Geth Pulse Rifle attacks.

actions.name: Radar Jamming
actions.description: The geth prime releases an emp burst that temporarily disables targeting systems. Each hostile creature within a <me-distance length='25' /> radius has disadvantage on ranged weapon attack rolls until the start of the geth prime's next turn.

actions.name: Summon Combat Drone
actions.description: The geth prime summons a Combat Drone. It can only have 1 Combat Drone active at a time.

actions.name: Summon Geth Turret
actions.description: The geth prime summons a Geth Turret.

legendaryActions.name: Activate Radar Jamming
legendaryActions.description: The geth prime activates its radar jamming.

legendaryActions.name: Geth Pulse Rifle Attack
legendaryActions.description: The geth prime makes a Geth Pulse Rifle attack.

legendaryActions.name: Summon Turret or Drone
legendaryActions.description: The geth prime uses its Summon Drone or Summon Geth Turret action.

features.name: Assassination
features.description: Once per turn, the geth stalker can deal an extra 7 (2d6) damage to one creature it hits with an attack if it has advantage on the attack roll. The attack must be made with a melee or ranged weapon.

features.name: Avoidance
features.description: If the geth stalker subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

features.name: Leap
features.description: The geth stalker can leap up to one half its speed.

features.name: Spider Climb
features.description: The geth stalker can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The geth trooper makes two Geth Pulse Rifle attacks.

actions.name: Shield Restore
actions.description: The geth turret restores 9 (2d8) shield points to a friendly creature within <me-distance length='10' />.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The guardian makes two M-358 Talon attacks.

features.name: Heavy Shield
features.description: While the guardian has their Heavy Shield equipped, it gains +2 AC and has resistance bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The harvester can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its acid spit and two with its stomp.

actions.name: Acid Spit
actions.hit: The harvester targets a <me-distance length='15' /> radius within <me-distance length='150' /> and launches a glob of acid that coats the area. Each creature within the area must succeed on a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw, taking 44 (8d10) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. Until the end of the harvester's next turn, each creature that enters the area or ends its turn there must also make the saving throw.

actions.name: Drop Klixen
actions.hit: If the harvester is within a region that contains Klixen, it begins the fight by droping 1d10 Klixen in a <me-distance length='15' /> by <me-distance length='50' /> area.

features.name: Frightful Presence
features.description: Each creature of the harvester's choice that is within <me-distance length='150' /> of the name and aware of it must succeed on a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw or become {frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the harvester's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

legendaryActions.name: Detect
legendaryActions.description: The harvester makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendaryActions.name: Stomp Attack
legendaryActions.description: The harvester makes a stomp attack.

legendaryActions.name: Trample Attack
legendaryActions.description: The harvester moves <me-distance length='25' /> in a straight line moving over Large or smaller creature in its path. Each creature caught in its path must succeed on a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw or take [dmg: 2d6 + 8] piercing damage and be knocked {prone}. The harvester cannot move through a Huge or larger creature.

actions.name: Gore
actions.hit: 12 (3d4 + 5) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Maul
actions.miss: Hit or miss, if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw or be knocked prone and is grappled. A creature takes half damage on a successful saving throw.

actions.name: Howl
actions.description: Each other kath hound within <me-distance length='50' /> that is not incapacitated gains +2 Dexterity and +1 Wisdom for 1 minute. Kath hounds can only benefit from one Howl at a time.

features.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
features.description: The kath hound has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

features.name: Pack Tactics
features.description: The kath hound has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kath hound's allies is within <me-distance length='5' /> of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

features.name: Grappler
features.description: The kath hound has advantage on attack rolls against any creature grappled by it.

actions.name: Swipe
actions.hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) slashing damage, and the creature is grappled (escape DC 13). A creature that is grappled by the husk takes 11 (3d6) necrotic damage at the start of each of the husk's turns. The husk can't make swipe attacks on any other target while grappling a creature in this way.

features.name: Aggressive
features.description: As a bonus action, the husk can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

actions.name: Bite
actions.hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Maul
actions.miss: Hit or miss, if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw or be knocked prone and is grappled. A creature takes half damage on a successful saving throw.

features.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
features.description: The kath hound has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

features.name: Pack Tactics
features.description: The kath hound has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kath hound's allies is within <me-distance length='5' /> of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

features.name: Grappler
features.description: The kath hound has advantage on attack rolls against any creature grappled by it.

actions.name: Frag Grenade III
actions.description: The assault trooper targets an area within <me-distance length="25" />. Each creature within <me-distance length="10" /> of the target must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 3d12 piercing damage or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Fire Breath
actions.description: The klixen exhales a 6-meter cone of fire. Each creature in that area must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

features.name: Death Burst
features.description: When the klixen dies, it explodes in a burst of lava. Each creature within <me-distance length='5' /> of it must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

features.name: Heated Body
features.description: A creature that touches the klixen or hits it with a melee attack while within <me-distance length='5' /> of it takes 3 (1d6) fire damage.

features.name: Chatter (variant)
features.description: The LOKI mech can be programmed with pre-recorded phrases, which it utters occasionally during combat. Each hostile creature that hears the phrase much pass a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, a creature becomes unnerved by the phrase and can only target the LOKI mech when making attack rolls or using damaging powers. On a success, a creature is unaffected and is immune to the LOKI mech's Chatter. The DC of the saving throw is dependant on the phrase, but cannot be higher than 12.

features.name: Limited Tactics
features.description: The LOKI mech is incapable of complex combat tactics. It never seeks cover and cannot take the Hide, Dodge, Help, or Disengage actions.

features.name: Post-mortem Explosion
features.description: When the LOKI mech is reduced to 0 hit points, it self-destructs. Each creature within a <me-distance length='5' adj />-radius sphere must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or take 5 (2d4) thunder damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The marauder makes 2 Phaeston attacks.

actions.name: Create Armor Plating
actions.description: The marauder coats a friendly husk, abomination, or cannibal in a scab-like armor plating, increasing the target's AC by 2.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The N7 demolisher makes three weapon attacks or two weapon attacks and uses one grenade.

actions.name: Arc Grenade III
actions.description: The N7 demolisher targets an area within <me-distance length="25" />. Each creature within <me-distance length="10" /> of the target must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 3d6 lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Homing Grenade I
actions.description: The N7 demolisher targets a creature within <me-distance length="25" />. The target suffers 1d6 thunder damage. Each other creature within <me-distance length="5" /> of the target must make a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature suffers 1d6 thunder damage or half as much on a successful one.

actions.name: Repair
actions.description: The N7 demolisher uses its action to repair a friendly, synthetic target within <me-distance length='5' /> for 2d8 hit points.

actions.name: Deploy Shield Pylon
actions.description: The N7 demolisher deploys a Shield Pylon to an unoccupied space within <me-distance length='5' />. The pylon has AC 10, 25 hit points and provides half cover. At the end of the N7 demolisher's turn, any fiendly creature within <me-distance length='10' /> of the pylon gains 2 shield points. Shield points gained this way cannot exceed the creatures maximum shield points.

features.name: N7 Training
features.description: The N7 demolisher has advantage on its first attack roll each turn.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The N7 Paladin makes two N7 Hurricane attacks.

features.name: Barrier
features.description: As a bonus action, the N7 Paladin gains 5 barrier ticks.

features.name: N7 Training
features.description: The N7 Paladin has advantage on its first attack roll each turn.

features.name: Omni-Shield
features.description: As a bonus action, the N7 Paladin deploys its omni-shield, lasting 1 minute. While the shield is deployed, the N7 Paladin gains +2 AC and can make a melee weapon attack with the shield: +5 to hit, <me-distance length='5' /> reach, 1d12 bludgeoning damage.

features.name: Variant: Fire-Shield
features.description: Gain all the benefits of Omni-Shield. In addition, targets hit by the Fire-Shield take 3d10 fire damage. This damage detonates primed targets, but the N7 Sentinel immune by any detonating effects.

features.name: Variant: Cryo-Shield
features.description: Gain all the benefits of Omni-Shield. In addition, a creature hit by the Cryo-Shield take 1d8 cold damage and must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or become Frozen until the end its next turn.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The N7 Slayer makes three monomolecular blade attacks.

features.name: Assassinate
features.description: During its first turn, the N7 Shadow has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the N7 Shadow scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

features.name: Evasion
features.description: If the N7 Shadow is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the N7 Shadow instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

features.name: N7 Training
features.description: The N7 Slayer has advantage on its first attack roll each turn.

features.name: Sneak Attack
features.description: Once per turn, the N7 Shadow deals an extra 14 (4d6) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within <me-distance length='5' /> of an ally of the N7 Shadow that isn't incapacitated and the N7 Shadow doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

features.name: Tactical Cloak
features.description: As a bonus action, the N7 Shadow activates its tactical cloak, becoming invisible for 1 minute. When the N7 Shadow makes a melee or ranged attack or uses a tech or combat power, tactical cloak ends.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The N7 Slayer makes three monomolecular blade attacks or two N7 Piranha attacks.

features.name: Aggressive
features.description: As a bonus action, the N7 Slayer can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

features.name: Avoidance
features.description: If the N7 Slayer is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

features.name: Barrier
features.description: As an action or bonus action, the N7 Slayer gains 5 barrier ticks.

features.name: N7 Training
features.description: The N7 Slayer has advantage on its first attack roll each turn.

reactions.name: Parry and Counter
reactions.description: The N7 Slayer adds 3 to its AC against one melee that would hit it. To do so, it must be able to see the target and be wielding a melee weapon. If the attack misses, the N7 Slayer can make one melee attack against the attacker if it is within its reach.

features.name: Pack Tactics
features.description: The nemesis has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the nemesis's allies is within <me-distance length='5' /> of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

features.name: Self-Destruct
features.description: When the nemesis dies, it explodes. Each creature within <me-distance length='10' /> of it must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 33 (6d10) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

features.name: Shadow Cloak
features.description: While in dim light or darkness, the nemesis can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

features.name: Surprise Attack
features.description: If the nemesis surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra [dmg] damage from the attack.

actions.name: Particle Beam
actions.description: The oculus fires a persistent particle beam that is <me-distance length='50' /> long and <me-distance length='5' /> wide that lasts until the start of the oculus's next turn. While firing the beam, the oculus's speed becomes 0. Each creature that is within the beam's path or that moves into the beam's path for the first time on its turn must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 66 (12d10) radiant damage, or half as much on a successful save.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The phantom makes three Monomolecular Blade attacks or one Palm Blaster attack and two Monomolecular  Blade (one-handed) attacks.

features.name: Aggressive
features.description: As a bonus action, the phantom can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

features.name: Avoidance
features.description: If the phantom subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

features.name: Barrier
features.description: As an action or bonus action, the phantom gains 8 barrier ticks. When the phantom is dealt damage, if it has any barrier ticks remaining, remove one barrier tick and reduce the damage by 1d8.

actions.name: Pounce
actions.description: The praetorian pounces to a location within <me-distance length='35' /> and makes a claw attack.

actions.name: Twin Particle Beams
actions.description: The praetorian shoots particle beams in a <me-distance length='25' adj /> line that is <me-distance length='10' /> wide originating from itself. Each creature within the area must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save a creature takes 54 (12d8) radiant damage or half as much on a successful one.

features.name: Barrier
features.description: When the praetorian is dealt damage, if it has any barrier ticks remaining, remove one barrier tick and reduce the damage by 1d8.

features.name: Possessed Praetorian
features.description: When the praetorian is possessed by a harbinger it gains 10 barrier ticks and while it has barrier ticks it also gains resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. It can use its action to launch 2 missiles at a single or different target creatures within 60m. Each target must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save a target takes 33 (6d10) thunder damage, or half as much on a successful one. Once the praetorian fires its missiles, it cannot do so again.

reactions.name: Negation Barrier
reactions.description: When targeted by a biotic power or tech power, the praetorian can use its reaction to gain 2 barrier ticks and gain resistance to force, necrotic, cold, lightning, and fire damage until the start of its next turn.

features.name: Pack Tactics
features.description: The pyjak has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the pyjak's allies is within <me-distance length='5' /> of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The brood warrior makes two Impale attacks or attempts to grapple a creature and makes an Impale attack.

actions.name: Acid Spit
actions.hit: 7 (2d6) acid damage and 7 (2d6) necrotic damage. This damage bypasses shields.

features.name: Barrier
features.description: As an action or bonus action, the rachni brood warrior gains 5 barrier ticks. When the rachni brood warrior is dealt damage, if it has any barrier ticks remaining, remove one barrier tick and reduce the damage by 1d8.

features.name: Grappler
features.description: The rachni brood warrior has advantage on attack rolls against any creature grappled by it.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The rachni queen makes one bite attack and two impale attacks.

lairActions.name: Call Workers
lairActions.description: The rachni queen summons 1d10 + 3 rachni workers. These arrive at the beginning of the queen's next turn and take their turn on the queen's initiative.

lairActions.name: Call Soldiers
lairActions.description: The rachni queen summons 1d6 + 1 rachni workers. These arrive at the beginning of the queen's next turn and take their turn on the queen's initiative.

lairActions.name: Call Brood Warrior
lairActions.description: The rachni queen summons one rachni brood warrior. It arrives at the beginning of the queen's next turn and takes its turn on the queen's initiative.

actions.name: Acid Spit
actions.hit: 7 (2d6) acid damage and 7 (2d6) necrotic damage. This damage bypasses shields.

features.name: Ambusher
features.description: The rachni soldier has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has surprised.

features.name: Grappler
features.description: The rachni soldier has advantage on attack rolls against any creature grappled by it.

actions.name: Acid Splash
actions.description: The rachni worker spits acid at one target within <me-distance length='25' /> or two targets within <me-distance length='25' /> if both targets are within <me-distance length='5' /> of each other. A target must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or take 3 (1d6) acid damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The rampart mech makes two omni-blade attacks.

features.name: Aggressive
features.description: As a bonus action, the rampart mech can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

features.name: Hex Shield
features.description: As a bonus action, the rampart mech generates a <me-distance length='5' /> tall and wide, hexagon-shaped shield with 5AC and 50 shield points which offers full-cover.

features.name: Tactical Cloak
features.description: As a bonus action, the rampart mech activates its tactical cloak, becoming invisible for 1 minute. When the rampart mech makes a melee or ranged attack or uses a tech or combat power, tactical cloak ends.

features.name: Post-Mortem Vent
features.description: When the rampart mech dies, it vents excess heat from its weapon and armor in a <me-distance length='5' /> radius until the start of its next turn. Each creature that enters the radius for the first time or ends its turn there takes 18 (4d8) radiant damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The ravager makes two twin artillery cannon attacks.

actions.name: Acid Splash
actions.description: The ravager spits acid in a <me-distance length='15' adj /> cube. Each creature in that line must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 27 (6d8) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

features.name: Egg Sacs
features.description: If the ravager takes piercing or slashing damage that is not from the result of a critical hit one of its egg sacs explodes, releasing 1d10 swarmers.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The reaper harvester makes two harvester cannon attacks.

actions.name: Harvester Cannon
actions.description: The reaper harvester targets a location within <me-distance length='75' />. Each creature within a <me-distance length='15' /> radius must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save a creature takes 3d10 force and 3d10 thunder damage, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendaryActions.name: Detect
legendaryActions.description: The reaper harvester makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendaryActions.name: Harvester Cannon Attack
legendaryActions.description: The reaper harvester makes a harvester cannon attack.

legendaryActions.name: Spawn Husks
legendaryActions.description: The reaper harvester releases 1d10 Husks from its body.

features.name: Tactical Cloak
features.description: As a bonus action, the recon drone activates its tactical cloak, becoming invisible for 1 minute. When the recon drome makes a melee or ranged attack or uses a tech or combat power, tactical cloak ends.

actions.name: Stabalize
actions.recharge: Recharges after a Short or Long rest
actions.description: The repair drone can stabalize a friendly creature within <me-distance length='5' />.

actions.name: Salvo
actions.description: The scion targets three locations within <me-distance length='75' /> and launches an explosive blast to each. The locations can be the same or different. Each creature within a <me-distance length='15' /> radius of a target location must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save a creature takes 15 (3d10) thunder damage or half as much on a successful one.

actions.name: Plague Sting
actions.hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) poison damage and 2 (1d4) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on DC 13 Constitution saving throw or has disadvantage on its next attack roll.

features.name: Barrier
features.description: When the seaker plague is dealt damage, if it has any barrier ticks remaining, remove one barrier tick and reduce the damage by 1d8.

actions.name: Sting
actions.hit: 2 (1d4) poison damage and the target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or has disadvantage on its next attack roll.

actions.name: Mass Accelerator Machinegun
actions.hit: 7 (2d6) piercing damage and 7 (2d6) radiant damage. The sentry turret can make a burst fire attack instead.

features.name: Stationary
features.description: The sentry turret automatically fails Strength and Dexterity saving throws and skill checks.

features.name: Surprise Attack
features.description: If the sniper surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 10 (3d6) damage from the attack.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The agent makes 2 attacks with its Scorpion.

actions.name: Flashbang Grenade III
actions.description: The eclipse trooper targets an area within <me-distance length="25" />. Each creature within <me-distance length="10" /> of the target must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature is <me-condition id="blinded"/> until the end of it's next turn.

actions.name: Explosive Decoy
actions.description: As an action, the agent detonates its active Decoy. Each creature within <me-distance length='10' /> of the decoy must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 3d6 thunder damage or half as much on a successful one.

features.name: Surprise Attack
features.description: If the agent surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 10 (3d6) damage from the attack.

actions.name: Suicide Attack
actions.hit: 3 (1d6) acid damage and the swarmer explodes (its hit points immediately fall to 0).

features.name: Aggressive
features.description: As a bonus action, the swarmer can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

actions.name: Acid Vomit
actions.description: The creeper regurgitates acid in a 4-meter cone. A creature within the code must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take 14 (4d6) acid damage.

features.name: Creeper Resemblance
features.description: The controller resembles a Thorian creeper. A creature that can see the controller can discern its true nature with a successful DC 15 Intelligence (Science) or Intelligence (Investigation) check.

features.name: Hive Mind Overseer
features.description: The controller gains a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls, ability checks, and saving throws for each creature within <me-distance length='50' /> of it that has the Hive Mind feature. This bonus cannot exceed +5.

features.name: Indoctrination
features.description: Unless a thorian controller is incapacitated, it is a source of indoctrination to all creatures within <me-distance length='250' /> of it. See the indoctrination condition.

name: Thorian Controller
author: Dakota P.
description: These creatures act as the eyes, ears, and mouth of the Thorian, issuing its commands while also informing on its enemies.

actions.name: Acid Vomit
actions.description: The creeper regurgitates acid in a 4-meter cone. A creature within the code must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take 7 (2d6) acid damage.

features.name: Hive Mind
features.description: If the creeper is within <me-distance length='50' /> of a Thorian Controller, it gains +1 to attack and damage rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

actions.name: Release Spores
actions.description: The nymph releases spores in a <me-distance length='10' adj />-radius sphere lasting until the end of its next turn. A creature that enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there takes 3 (1d6) psychic damage and must make a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature becomes paralyzed until the start of its next turn.

name: Thorian Nymph
description: In its juvenile stage, the Thorian becomes mobile and sneaks aboard unknowing ships to spread across the galaxy.
author: Dakota P.

actions.name: Release Spores
actions.description: The spawn releases spores in a <me-distance length='10' />-radius sphere lasting until the end of its next turn. A creature that enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there takes 3 (1d6) psychic damage and must make a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature becomes paralyzed until the start of its next turn.

features.name: Rooted
features.description: The spawn in rooted in the ground and cannot be moved. It automatically fails Strength and Dexterity saving throws and skill checks.

name: Thorian Spawn
description: The beginning of a Thorian's life cycle, these stationary plants feed off nutrients from the mother plant while also acting as a last line of defense against intruders.
author: Dakota P.

features.name: Hive Mind
features.description: If the creeper is within <me-distance length='50' /> of a Thorian Controller, it gains +1 to attack and damage rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

features.name: Enslaved Mind
features.description: The thrall loses all levels of indoctrination reverts to its normal self if the controlling Thorian dies.

features.name: Random Thrall (variant)
features.description: Thralls can be any organic humanoid with an intelligence of 4 or greater. Instead, you may use the stat block of a randomly generated grunt or other organic humanoid from the bestiary.

name: Thorian Thrall
description: The poor slaves of the Thorian, they act as the reminder of the dangers of the frontier. Kill the Thorian to end their suffering.
author: Dakota P.

actions.name: Indoctrinate
actions.description: The thorian targets one creature within <me-distance length='300' /> of it that it or one of its controllers, thralls, or creepers can see. That creature must make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or suffer a level of indoctrination.

actions.name: Summon Thrall
actions.description: The thorian summons a thrall to its aid. It arrives on initiative count 20 somewhere along the thorian's root structure.

features.name: Indoctrination
features.description: Unless a thorian controller is incapacitated, it is a source of indoctrination to all creatures within 1<me-distance length='0' /> of it. See the indoctrination condition.

features.name: Root Structure
features.description: One a thorian reaches maturity, it's roots grow at a rate of <me-distance length="5" numOnly /> to <me-distance length="10" /> per year. Over time, these roots create vast tunnel systems and caverns that act as the thorian's lair.

features.name: Neural Nodes
features.description: The thorian has 4 + 1d4 neural nodes located along its root structure, spread throughout its lair. At start of its turn, the thorian gains 2d12 points for each remaining neural node. Each node has AC 10 and 30 (6d6 + 10) hit points.

lairActions.name: Create Spawn
lairActions.description: The thorian sprouts 1d12 + 3 thorian spawn. These spawn can appear in an unoccupied space within <me-distance length='5' /> of any part of the thorian's root structure. The spawn take their turn at the end of the thorian's turn.

lairActions.name: Summon Creeper
lairActions.description: The thorian summons 1d8 + 4 thorian creepers. These creepers can appear in an unoccupied space within <me-distance length='5' /> of any part of the thorian's root structure. The creepers take their turn at the end of the thorian's turn.

lairActions.name: Summon Controller
lairActions.description: The thorian summons 1d4 thorian controllers. These controllers can appear in an unoccupied space within <me-distance length='5' /> of any part of the thorian's root structure. The controllers take their turn at the end of the thorian's turn.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The thresher maw can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes four attacks: one with its grasp, two with its tail, one with its acid spit. It can use its Swallow instead of its grasp.

actions.name: Acid Spit
actions.hit: The thresher maw targets a <me-distance length='15' /> radius within <me-distance length='150' /> and launches a glob of acid that coats the area. Each creature within the area must succeed on a DC 22 Dexterity saving throw, taking 44 (8d10) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. Until the end of the thresher maw's next turn, each creature that enters the area or ends its turn there must also make the saving throw.

actions.name: Grasp
actions.hit: 29 (3d12 + 10) bludgeoning damage and 13 (2d12) acid damage. If the target is a creature, it is grappled (escape DC 22). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the thresher maw can't grasp another target.

actions.name: Swallow
actions.description:
The thresher maw makes one grasp attack against a Large or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target takes the grasp's damage, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the thresher maw, and it takes 56 (16d6) acid damage at the start of each of the thresher maw's turns.
--If the thresher maw takes 60 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the thresher maw must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within <me-distance length='10' /> of the thresher maw. If the thresher maw dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using <me-distance length='30' /> of movement, exiting prone.

actions.name: Tail
actions.hit: 24 (4d6 + 10) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 22 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

features.name: Destroy Terrain
features.description: When the thresher maw moves via burrowing, the ground it moves through becomes difficult terrain.

features.name: Frightful Presence
features.description: Each creature of the thresher maw's choice that is within <me-distance length='150' /> of the name and aware of it must succeed on a DC 22 Wisdom saving throw or become {frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the thresher maw's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

features.name: Legendary Resistance
features.description: If the thresher maw fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

features.name: Siege Monster
features.description: The thresher maw deals double damage to objects and structures.

legendaryActions.name: Acid Spit Attack
legendaryActions.description: The thresher maw makes an acid spit attack.

legendaryActions.name: Move
legendaryActions.description: The thresher maw moves up to half its speed.

legendaryActions.name: Tail Attack
legendaryActions.description: The thresher maw makes a tail attack.

actions.name: Mass Accelerator Machinegun
actions.hit: 7 (2d6) piercing damage and 7 (2d6) radiant damage. The turret can make a burst fire attack instead.

features.name: Stationary
features.description: The turret automatically fails Strength and Dexterity saving throws and skill checks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

features.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
features.description: The varren alpha has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

features.name: Pack Tactics
features.description: The varren alpha has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the varren alpha's allies is within <me-distance length='5' /> of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Bite
actions.hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

features.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
features.description: The varren has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

features.name: Pack Tactics
features.description: The varren has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the varren's allies is within <me-distance length='5' /> of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The adjutant makes two Arm Cannon attacks.

actions.name: Reaper Infection
actions.target: one organic creature that is grappled by the [name], incapacitated, or restrained
actions.hit: 3 (1d6) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0. An organic creature slain in this way becomes a Weakened Adjutant and becomes an Adjutant after a long rest.

features.name: Grappler
features.description: The weakened adjutant has advantage on attack rolls against any creature grappled by it.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The yahg makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

features.name: Assassinate
features.description: During its first turn, the yahg has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the yahg scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

features.name: Avoidance
features.description: If the yahg subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

features.name: Sneak Attack
features.description: The yahg  deals an extra 13 (4d6) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within <me-distance length='5' /> of an ally of the yahg that isn't incapacitated and the yahg doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

actions.name: Mass Accelerator Machinegun
actions.hit: 16 (3d10) piercing damage and 16 (3d10) radiant damage. The ymir mech can make a burst fire attack instead.

actions.name: Rocket Launcher
actions.description: The ymir mech targets an area within <me-distance length='150' />. Each creature within <me-distance length='15' /> of the target must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 52 (8d12) thunder damage or half as much damage on a successful one.

features.name: Post-mortem Explosion
features.description: When the YMIR mech is reduced to 0 hit points, it self-destructs. Each creature within a <me-distance length='15' adj />-radius sphere must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 22 (4d10) thunder damage or half as much on a successful one.
